results.title: Smithy
results.creator_credit: Ken G. Hall, N.P. Pery and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: This biography of pioneering aviator Sir Charles Kingsford Smith was modelled on the Hollywood biopic, and the Cinesound production team’s smooth professionalism matched Hollywood production values. The emphasis is on Smithy’s heroism, and although some conflict is provided by his doubts and domestic problems, the filmmakers seem to be more interested in Smithy’s obsessive quest for perfection. The Pacific flight, the peak of his achievement, rather than his final disappearance, provides an appropriate climax. Smithy’s old plane, the Southern Cross was resurrected from storage and flown by two of its old pilots. The film is also notable for the appearance of former Prime Minister William Morris Hughes as himself. Cast includes Ron Randell as Smithy and Muriel Steinbeck as Lady Kingsford Smith.

results.title: In the wake of the Bounty
results.brief_description: Chauvel’s first “talkie”, this film merges documentary footage and dramatic historical reconstruction. Re-enacts the mutiny led by Fletcher Christian (Errol Flynn) in 1789 against the master of the Bounty, William Bligh (Mayne Lynton), and depicts the fate of the mutineers on Tahiti and remote Pitcairn Island. Provides a unique and spectacular record of the life of the isolated community of Pitcairn in 1932 with most of the inhabitants being descendants of the Bounty mutineers. This was the first film shot on Pitcairn Island and the first in which the Australian actor, Errol Flynn, appeared. The dramatised footage was shot at the Cinesound Studio in Sydney. Cast also includes Victor Gouriet and John Warwick

results.title: Only angels have wings
results.brief_description: Cary Grant heads a ramshackle cargo outfit in the wilds of South America, forced to fly in the most perilous of weather conditions to the most treacherous of destinations. Facing death on a near-hourly basis, Grant and his flyers have adopted a casual, all-in-a-day’s work attitude towards their mortality. Bringing more than a touch of glamour, and tension, to the sleepy one-saloon outpost is a showgirl (Jean Arthur) on her way to a nightclub engagement in Panama, and a fellow aviator’s beautiful wife (Rita Hayworth). Cast includes: Cary Grant, Jean Arthur, Rita Hayworth, Richard Barthelmess and Thomas Mitchell.

results.title: The One that got away
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Julian Wintle and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic true story of the only German prisoner of war taken in Britain who escaped from captivity and successfully returned to Germany; Luftwaffe pilot Lieutenant Franz Von Werra (Hardy Kruger). Von Werra was captured during the Battle of Britain when his Messerschmitt was shot down in the English countryside. The film is significant in that it was made during the period after World War 2 when the majority of British films paid homage to the heroism of British troops. Von Werra’s meticulous and determined bid for freedom took him across England, Canada, the United States, until he finally reached home. Screenplay by Howard Clewes from the book by Kendal Burt and James Leasor. Cast includes Hardy Kruger, Colin Gordon, Michael Goodliffe and Terence Alexander.

results.title: City on fire
results.creator_credit: Ringo Lam and Media Asia Distribution
results.brief_description: Charismatic Hong Kong film star Chow Yun Fat stars in Ringo Lam’s explosive action film about an undercover cop whose investigation into a series of jewelery robberies around Hong Kong draws him into a dangerous circle of new friends. He becomes buddies with a member of this gang (Danny Lee) and is soon involved in the gang’s next big heist. This is a classic example of the Hong Kong action film genre. (Awards: Winner of Best Director and Best Actor at the 7th Annual Hong Kong Film Awards) In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Mysterians
results.creator_credit: Ishiro Honda, Carlos Montalban, Peter Riethof, Tomoyuki Tanaka and RKO Teleradio Pictures
results.brief_description: Homeless aliens from a ruined planet decide to make Earth their new home in this Japanese horror outing. Soon after the mysterious brainiacs, who arrive in giant flying saucers accompanied by an enormous death-ray spewing robotic bird, establish themselves in a special dome, they demand that the Earth men bring them lots of pretty women so they can start replenishing their depleted population. Special effects by Eiji Tsuburaya.

results.title: Glen or Glenda
results.creator_credit: Edward Wood Jr, George Weiss, Paramount Pictures and Screen Classics
results.brief_description: In his heart-felt cinematic debut, Edward D. Wood, Jr. himself stars under the pseudonym Daniel Davis as a young man with a dilemma: should he tell his lovely young fiancee (played by real-life girlfriend Dolores Fuller) about his burning desire to cross-dress? She has begun to notice articles of clothing missing from her closet; the suspense builds, what should he do? Bela Lugosi plays the omniscient narrator; note his conviction as he “pulls the strings.” Amidst this unintentionally hilarious mish-mash of melodrama, social commentary and inexplicable stock footage, there is something for every taste: countless cross dressers, hallucinatory dream sequences, sex-change surgeries, spirited cat fights, borderline-pornographic simulated sex scenes, poetic monologues, a haunted house, and a stampede of wild buffalo. Released under various titles across the country — I Lived Two Lives, I Changed My Sex — this fiasco bombed across the board but managed to gain Wood enough notoriety in the “B”-movie world to launch a career that is today the stuff of legend. Hailed by most critics as the worst film of all time. Includes Bela Lugosi film promos: ‘Dracula’, ‘The Body Snatchers’, ‘Frankenstein meets the Wolfman’, ‘Plan 9 from Outer Space’ & ‘Abbott and Costello meet Frankenstein’.

results.title: James Dean: the first American teenager
results.creator_credit: Ray Connolly, David Puttnam, Sandy Lieberson and Good Times Enterprises
results.brief_description: This documentary narrated by Stacey Keach attempts to look behind the mask of the shy young tragic screen icon, James Dean. Footage from early television appearances, stills from his life, and clips from his three films are interwoven with interviews with his co-workers. Includes interviews with Sal Mineo, Nicholas Ray, Dennis Hopper, Carroll Baker and Natalie Wood, among others.

results.title: The Brain that wouldn't die
results.creator_credit: Joseph Green, Mort Landberg, Rex Carlton and Rex Carlton Productions
results.brief_description: After a car crash, a man keeps his wife’s head alive in his laboratory. As if this weren’t enough, an evil beast pounds and screams from a locked room adjacent to the lab, for some reason the film ends with the title “The Head that Wouldn’t Die” instead of “The Brain that Wouldn’t Die.” Cast includes Jason Evers (Dr. Bill Cortner, as Herb Evers), Virginia Leith (Jan Compton), Leslie Daniels (Kurt), Adele Lamont (Doris Powell), Bonnie Sharie (Blonde Stripper), Paula Maurice (Brunette Stripper), Marilyn Hanold (Peggy Howard) and Bruce Brighton (Dr. Cortner).

results.title: Battle beyond the sun
results.creator_credit: Alexander Kozyr, Francis Ford Coppola and American International Pictures (AIP)
results.brief_description: Roger Corman and future super director Francis Ford Coppola (using the pseudonym Thomas Colchart), are behind this sci-fi adventure of two warring hemispheres competing to be the first on Mars. Instead, they end up lost and landing in a small store where monsters (suspiciously shaped like male and female genitalia) constantly battle it out. The bulk of the scenes come from the Soviet sci-fi adventure Nebo Zovyot, which Corman had purchased a few years before. He dropped the cold-war aspects and assigned young Coppola to rewrite, edit and produce the film. Music by Les Baxter.
